CatDescriptText: Cutline of image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, October 20, 1945, pg. 3, reads: "Fought Union With Race Ridicule - When a male picket of Teamsters' Union 944 began walking up and down before his fruit market at Eighth Avenue near Amity Street, Homestead, Monday morning, V. Stone, the proprietor (center) used race ridicule to combat the picket. An extremely fat, dark, short-haired woman, attired in a flour sack, with a large chrysanthemum pinned on her lapel, began to walk up and down with the picket shortly after he appeared.  She had a sign which read, 'Just Married, On Our Honeymoon, Ain't Love Grand' pinned on her.  Complaints of Negroes and whites in vicinity against Proprietor Stone's 'stunt' caused quite a disturbance and brought about withdrawal of the fat woman shortly after she took up her march. - Harris Photo."
TitMainTitle: Union picketer from Teamsters' Local 944 outside V. Stone Fruit Market next to Shupink's Jewelry, with man wearing apron adjusting produce display in background, Eighth Avenue, Homestead
